data.text: @tusongtrader @cnnphilippines Just look at what's happening to South Korea and Hk right now, we must do what we can as individuals to at least try to help prevent this kind of situation from happening here in our country.

@tusongtrader @cnnphilippines We must not get too complacent, the virus is constantly mutating and the omicron subvariant is already here in the Philippines,we must at least do our part by being more cautious,disinfect always,practice social distancing,etc.we must all do our part in our own little way

@jnt989 @cnnphilippines You have already answered your question about why data is too good to be true. Hospital capacity versus the need for its capacity is what is more important than the numbers by itself.
@jnt989 @cnnphilippines What is your solution on this?

@tusongtrader @cnnphilippines If there is an efficient method of reliable mass testing, then the data will be more reliable. It's a sad fact that people avoid going to the doctor and hospital confinement and brush off symptoms to avoid hospital bills and the stigma of being infected.

@tusongtrader @cnnphilippines There are so many people who experience mild symptoms who do not have themselves tested anymore, and there is this New Omicron subvariant that is harder to detect. HK is experiencing a surge with patients in hospital beds situated outside the hospital.
